ygData.subject: A rose by any other name...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Spent the last 2+1/2 weeks on the other side of the continent from my puter, so I can totally relate. Neeeeeeeed mah fix... :) ... afraid to play her now,
ygData.messageBody:
> getting much game time...Is really hard for this
> newbie who is itching to play, play, play...Here is

Spent the last 2+1/2 weeks on the other side of the
continent from my puter, so I can totally relate.
Neeeeeeeed mah fix... :)

>but am wanting to add a couple characters to play
>with when he is over at Fennin...While I am too
afraid >to play her now, I have thoughts of an
Enchanter but >am also thinking of a Druid
character...I have a name
I'd personally recommend the Druid for now, Enchanters
are *VERY* group dependant, whereas Druids are the
exact opposite. You're never at a loss for things to
do with a Druid, plus the ability to travel is a
luxury that's difficult to give up. (always having
SoW, porting whenever you feel like it, being able to
solo yellow and in some cases low red conning MOBs,
etc.)

>for my Enchanter but am at a loss for something
really >creative for my Druid...Any suggestions on
websites >for research for a name?

By far the hardest part of the game. ;) I've still
gotta pick last names for my Druid and Rogue...

>Guess I could go to Google but I thought I
>would check with you guys first. Also, any
>suggestions for a really easy quest for my Cleric?

Well, depends on your level range, but once you hit
the late teens, you should attempt the Testament of
Vanear quest. It's a relatively simple quest for a 10
WIS 10 mana secondary weapon slot book.

> One I might be able to do fairly easily on my own?

The only combat portion of the Testament quest is
killing Dyllan Starshine in Highpass. He's a long
camp, seven hour respawn time, but a fairly easy kill
in the high teens to low 20's. Aside from that, it's
just a quick trip to Qeynos to meet with an NPC
outside of Crow's Tavern. (the erudite in the purple
robe, forget his name) Check allakhazam.com for the
complete rundown of the quest.

>I have got to start learning this game on my own
>instead of just doing what HE tells me to do...you
>know, AUTO FOLLOW, ASSIST, Here take
>this..LOL...LOL...I keep running around Freeport
>afraid to go out cause I don't know if I could find
my >way back...I sound pathetic don't I?? :-)

The quick fix for that is Bind Affinity and Gate, with
those no matter what you can always gate back to your
bind spot. Part of why I recommended the druid is that
once you get your first round of teleports, your
freedom to travel greatly increases, you can always
just port back to a druid circle you know. (if you're
parked in Freeport you've probably seen the circle in
West Commonlands)
